awd_abstract_narration: The Synthetic Organic Program is supporting the research of Dr.                 David J. Hart of the Department of Chemistry at Ohio State                      University.  Dr. Hart is a pioneer in the development of                        intermolecular free radical addition reactions for use in                       organic synthesis.                                                                                                                                              In the current project, stannyl ethers of benzopinacols will be                 investigated as sources of tin radicals which, in turn, will                    mediate conjugate and azomethine addition reactions.  The study                 of beta-stannylboranes as reagents for coupling alkyl halides,                  alkyl selenides, nitroalkanes and xanthates to electron                         deficient alkenes will also be undertaken.  Another objective                   of the research will be to investigate the stereochemical                       course of the intermolecular reactions of alpha-carboalkoxy,                    alpha-alkoxy and alpha-acylamino radicals.  Substrates for the                  reactions of these radicals will include trialkyltin hydrides,                  allylstannanes and electron deficient alkenes.  The results of                  the studies will be compared to the related alkylations of                      ester enolates and carbonyl addition reactions.
